newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia noon rubber prices down on weak sentiment.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia noon rubber prices down on weak sentiment.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were down at noon as the market continued to drift without buying interest, traders said.
"We're hoping to pitch to some short-coverers today, if anyone emerges," said a trader. "Otherwise, it'll be another quiet day."
At midday, the benchmark April RSS1 buyer was quoted at 305 cents ($1.23) a kg by the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board (MRELB), down half cent from Monday's close.
The board quoted April SMR20 buyer down half cent at 292 cents.
Traders offered the SMR20 at 292 cents a kg, SMR CV at 358, SMR L at 338, SMR 5 at 300, SMR 10 at 295 and latex at 235.
Traders said on Friday that prices were expected to fluctuate "one cent up or down" through the week.
